sentences: Ta kandis oma nime 체li천pilaste nimekirja.
Tema nimi on lisatud v천istkonna nimekirja.
context: The word 'nimekirja' is the illative case of 'nimekiri', meaning 'into a list' or 'onto a register'. In Estonian grammar, the illative case indicates movement into something or inclusion in something. This form suggests that someone or something has been added to or entered into a list or record. For example, when a student is registered at a university, their name would be 'added to the register' (nimekirja kandma).
